exception-details.agreementSummary: The Tiering service appears to be out of date. Mr Brown confirmed that Mr Bertrand is *high risk*

roshAnswers.R10.1:
[R10.1] IN CUSTODY

KNOWN ADULTS:
Such as Ms Elaine Underhill and any of the victims of the index offence if they are placed close to Mr Smith cell.

CHILDREN:

roshAnswers.R10.2:
[R10.2] IN CUSTODY:

KNOWN ADULTS:
Intimidation, threats of violence, use of weapons or boiling water, physical education and violent assault, long term psychological impact as a result of Mr Smith violent behaviour. This harm may be cause in the course of physical altercation due to seeking revenge or holding grudges...
roshAnswers.R10.3:
[R10.3] STATIC RISK FACTORS:

Mr Smith gender - At the time of the offence, Mr Smith was 35 years old and considered to be in the higher risk group.

STABLE DYNAMIC RISK FACTORS:
Thinking and behaviour - limited ability to manage mood or emotions poor impulse control. Mr Smith demonstrated cognitive deficit in committing the index offences and this still remains a concern...
roshAnswers.R10.4:
[R10.4] CIRCUMSTANCES:
A lack of stable accommodation
unemployment
non constructive use of time
breakdown of family support
being unable to access benefits

UNDERLYING FACTORS:
pro criminal attitudes supporting commission of crime...
roshAnswers.R10.5:
[R10.5] Engage with Mental Health Services in prison and in the community.
Maintain emotional stability.
Abstain from alcohol.
Abstain from illegal drugs.
Regular testing for alcohol and drug use, in prison and on Licence.
Maintain stable accommodation...

riskManagementAnswers.RM28: [RM28] Mr Smith is currently on remand awaiting sentence
riskManagementAnswers.RM28.1: [RM28.1] Currently on remand at HMP Wandsworth - Management of case under MAPPA - level not yet set.
riskManagementAnswers.RM30: [RM30] Probation Officer, Education training and employment Officer, Prison Offender Supervisor
riskManagementAnswers.RM31: [RM31] State they will have secure accommodation for Mr Smith  and partner on release, although she too is subject to a DRR at present. Supportive wider family.  Has completed previously Short Duration programme and attended one of the support sessions .  Engaged with CARATS in custody.  Complied with voluntary drug tests in custody. Some motivation to desist from alcohol/drug use in the future, this needs to be encouraged with use of community resources. Completed drug and heroin awareness programmes in custody.
riskManagementAnswers.RM32: [RM32] Requires referral to community drug DIP upon  release. To link in with employment/training resources such as College and ETEO. Completion of victim empathy module via 1-1 supervision to build upon awareness of impact of offending.   Level setting to be undertaken by Senior Probation Officer and OMU. Multi Agency Public Protection Panel to be convened if level 2 either at start of supervision or 6 months prior to release
riskManagementAnswers.RM33: [RM33] Undertake sentence planning with OS within 8 or 16 weeks of sentence carats - continue to work with Mr Smith and refer for relevant programmes during any prison sentence imposed. DIP supervise DRR is imposed or provide support post release if conditions/requirements to manage the specific risks.
riskManagementAnswers.RM34: [RM34] Discuss any concerns with line manager/SPO Increase frequency of reporting Bring forward MAPPA/Consider Level 2 MAPPA professionals meetings  considered if MAPPA not applicable. Consider referral to Approved Premises Consider motivational interviewing/engagement officer.  Joint interview with police OM or other relevant agencies? To raise concerns Referral to substance misues worker for additional support. Warning letters to be employed Recall/Breach if risk not manageable.

riskManagementSummaries.label: Further considerations
riskManagementSummaries.answer: [RM28] Mr Smith is currently on remand awaiting sentence

riskManagementSummaries.label: Key information about current situation
riskManagementSummaries.answer: [RM28.1] Currently on remand at HMP Wandsworth - Management of case under MAPPA - level not yet set.

riskManagementSummaries.label: Supervision
riskManagementSummaries.answer: [RM30] Probation Officer, Education training and employment Officer, Prison Offender Supervisor

riskManagementSummaries.label: Monitoring and control
riskManagementSummaries.answer: [RM31] State they will have secure accommodation for Mr Smith  and partner on release, although she too is subject to a DRR at present. Supportive wider family.  Has completed previously Short Duration programme and attended one of the support sessions .  Engaged with CARATS in custody.  Complied with voluntary drug tests in custody. Some motivation to desist from alcohol/drug use in the future, this needs to be encouraged with use of community resources. Completed drug and heroin awareness programmes in custody.

riskManagementSummaries.label: Interventions and treatment
riskManagementSummaries.answer: [RM32] Requires referral to community drug DIP upon  release. To link in with employment/training resources such as College and ETEO. Completion of victim empathy module via 1-1 supervision to build upon awareness of impact of offending.   Level setting to be undertaken by Senior Probation Officer and OMU. Multi Agency Public Protection Panel to be convened if level 2 either at start of supervision or 6 months prior to release

riskManagementSummaries.label: Victim safety planning
riskManagementSummaries.answer: [RM33] Undertake sentence planning with OS within 8 or 16 weeks of sentence carats - continue to work with Mr Smith and refer for relevant programmes during any prison sentence imposed. DIP supervise DRR is imposed or provide support post release if conditions/requirements to manage the specific risks.

riskManagementSummaries.label: Contingency plans
riskManagementSummaries.answer: [RM34] Discuss any concerns with line manager/SPO Increase frequency of reporting Bring forward MAPPA/Consider Level 2 MAPPA professionals meetings  considered if MAPPA not applicable. Consider referral to Approved Premises Consider motivational interviewing/engagement officer.  Joint interview with police OM or other relevant agencies? To raise concerns Referral to substance misues worker for additional support. Warning letters to be employed Recall/Breach if risk not manageable.

risk-management-features.manageRiskDetails: Mr Bertrand's movements need to be monitored especially at night to ensure that he does not make content with previous victims.
risk-management-features.additionalFeaturesDetails: Mr Bertrand should be tested for drug use regularly as he has been known to conceal this in the past.

rehabilitative-interventions.summary: Mr Bertrand must continue to address the behaviour which has led to offending in the past. These activities will support him in avoid reoffending.

selectedCaseNotes.note: This is a sensitive case note

adjudications.offenceDescription: Intentionally or recklessly sets fire to any part of a prison or any other property, whether or not his own
Commits any assault - all assault on other person

(a) Attempts to commit, (b) incites another inmate to commit, or (c) assists another inmate to commit or to attempt to commit, any of the foregoing offences - at incite or assist to set fire to prison or prop
Intentionally or recklessly sets fire to any part of a prison or any other property, whether or not his own

describe-location-factors.positiveFactors: Mr Bertrand's family live in Otley and his sister is in Tadcaster. After a successful AP placement, he plans to move in with one or other, depending on circumstances and the progress which has been made.
describe-location-factors.restrictionDetail: Mr Bertrand must avoid the Old Trafford area, where the index offence was committed.

room-sharing.sharingConcernsDetail: Mr Bertrand has a history of influencing others.
room-sharing.sharingBenefitsDetail: Mr Bertrand has benefitted from sharing cell and from increased social contact. Be aware of his history of influencing cell mates.

vulnerability.exploitOthersDetail: Mr Bertrand has a history of influencing others to participate in offences to obtain opiates

rfap-details.motivation: Mr Bertrand has been on DART and demonstrated progress
rfap-details.continuedRecovery: Mr Bertand has committed to joining the local AA in Leeds.

placement-duration.reason: This has been stipulated by the Parole Board Dec 12, 2023

plans-in-place.plansNotInPlaceDetail: Mr Bertrand intends to move in with either this sister in Tadcaster or his own family in Otley

selectedDocuments.description: Personal circumstance of AP - Medication in Posession  - Assessment started on 11/09/2019
Pre-Sentence Report - Fast requested by Sheffield Crown Court on 04/09/2018
Parole Assessment Report at Berwyn (HMP) requested on 05/09/2019
